summary_visit.AdmissionSummary: A 45-year-old female with a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and arthritis was admitted on 09/15/2024 with acute influenza A infection following a 2-day history of fever, cough, sore throat, and body aches. On admission, she was febrile and appeared ill, with a positive rapid antigen test confirming influenza A. Laboratory findings included an elevated white blood cell count of 12,000/µL, with other labs within normal limits. Initial management included supportive care with hydration, antipyretics (acetaminophen), and a cough suppressant (dextromethorphan). During the hospital course, the patient showed gradual improvement in symptoms, with decreased fever and resolution of the cough by 09/17/2024.

notes.note_content:
Date: 09/15/2024

Author: Michael Palmolivi, MD

Subjective:

  • CC: Fever, cough, body aches
  • HPI: Patient presents with a 2-day history of fever, cough, sore throat, and body aches. PMH includes arthritis, hypertension, hyperlipidemia. Medications: Esomeprazole 40 mg daily PO, Lisinopril 20 mg daily, Atorvastatin 40 mg daily, [Arthritis medications]. Allergies: NKDA.

Objective:

  • Vitals: T 101.5°F, HR 95 bpm, RR 20, BP 130/80 mmHg, O2 Sat 96% on RA
  • Physical Exam: General: Appears ill. Cardiovascular: RRR, no murmurs, rubs, or gallops. Respiratory: Clear lung sounds bilaterally, mild cough. Abdomen: Soft, non-tender, non-distended. Throat: Erythematous pharynx.
  • Labs: Influenza A positive by rapid antigen test. CBC: WBC 12,000/µL. CMP: WNL.

Assessment:

  • Acute influenza A infection

Plan:

  • Admit to the hospital for supportive care and monitoring
  • Rest, hydration
  • Antipyretics (e.g., acetaminophen)
  • Cough suppressant (e.g., dextromethorphan)

Date: 09/16/2024

Author: Michael Palmolivi, MD

Subjective:

  • Patient Report: Persistent cough, mild fatigue

Objective:

  • Vitals: T 100.2°F, HR 85 bpm, RR 18, BP 120/80 mmHg, O2 Sat 98% on RA
  • Physical Exam: Respiratory: Improved lung sounds, less productive cough.

Assessment:

  • Improving influenza A infection

Plan:

  • Continue supportive care

Date: 09/17/2024

Author: Michael Palmolivi, MD

Subjective:

  • Patient Report: Decreased symptoms, feeling better

Objective:

  • Vitals: T 98.6°F, HR 80 bpm, RR 18, BP 120/80 mmHg, O2 Sat 98% on RA
  • Physical Exam: Respiratory: Clear lung sounds, no cough.

Assessment:

  • Resolving influenza A infection

Plan:

  • Discharge home
  • Continue rest, hydration
  • Follow-up with primary care physician as needed

Date: 09/18/2024

Author: Michael Palmolivi, MD

Subjective:

  • Summary of Hospital Course: Patient was admitted with acute influenza A infection. Treated with supportive care. Patient has clinically improved.

Objective:

  • Vitals: T 98.6°F, HR 80 bpm, RR 18, BP 120/80 mmHg, O2 Sat 98% on RA
  • Physical Exam: General: Appears well. Respiratory: Clear lung sounds.

Assessment:

  • Resolved influenza A infection

Plan:

  • Discharge home
  • Continue rest, hydration
  • Continue Lisinopril 20 mg daily and Atorvastatin 40 mg daily
  • Follow-up with primary care physician as needed
